snippet: Analysts say China’s overriding fear is that a collapse of North Korea would bring reunification with the South and a flood of refugees over the Chinese border.
abstract: China continues to support North Korea, despite North Korea's dismissal of appeals not to test its new longer-range missile, fearing that collapse of Communist government in  Pyongyang could lead to reunification of Korean Peninsula under government in Seoul allied with United States; while China finds idea of nearby American presence untenable, its continued support of Kim Jong-un may lead to intervention by United States and its allies.
lead_paragraph: Analysts say China’s overriding fear is that a collapse of North Korea would bring reunification with the South and a flood of refugees over the Chinese border.

headline.seo: China Stays Beside North Korea, a Buffer Against the U.S.
headline.main: Despite Risks, China Stays at North Korea’s Side to Keep the U.S. at Bay
headline.print_headline: Despite Risks, China Stays at North Korea’s Side to Keep the U.S. at Bay
